name: Persimmon and Orange Salad
description: Squat, roundish Fuyu persimmons are the ones to use raw in salads. (The pointy Hachiya variety is better ripened to softness for desserts.) Paired with sweet oranges and watercress, they make a refreshing autumn salad. They barely need dressing at all, but a little sherry vinegar adds brightness.
keywords: fall, orange, persimmon, watercress, side dish, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch watercress, curly cress, or upland cress, optional

recipeInstructions.text: Put the shallot and vinegar in a small bowl and macerate 5 minutes. Add a pinch of salt and a little pepper. Whisk in the olive oil.
With a serrated knife, peel the oranges, then slice into 1/2-inch rounds. Arrange the orange slices on a platter.
Peel the persimmons, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices or wedges and arrange over the oranges.
The salad can be covered and refrigerated up to 3 hours. Just before serving, whisk the dressing again and drizzle over the fruit. Garnish with watercress sprigs, if you like.
